verses.plain: Paul, a servant of God, and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of God’s elect, and the acknowledging of the truth which is after godliness;

tokens.t: Paul, a servant of God, and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of God’s elect, and the acknowledging of the truth which is after godliness;

verses.plain: In hope of eternal life, which God, that cannot lie, promised before the world began;

tokens.t: In hope of eternal life, which God, that cannot lie, promised before the world began;

verses.plain: But hath in due times manifested his word through preaching, which is committed unto me according to the commandment of God our Saviour;

tokens.t: But hath in due times manifested his word through preaching, which is committed unto me according to the commandment of God our Saviour;

verses.plain: To Titus, mine own son after the common faith: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Saviour.

tokens.t: To Titus,
own son after the common faith: Grace, mercy,
peace, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Saviour.

verses.plain: For this cause left I thee in Crete, that thou shouldest set in order the things that are wanting, and ordain elders in every city, as I had appointed thee:

tokens.t: For this cause left I thee in Crete, that thou shouldest set in order the things that are wanting, and ordain elders in every city, as I had appointed thee:

verses.plain: If any be blameless, the husband of one wife, having faithful children not accused of riot or unruly.

tokens.t: If any be blameless, the husband of one wife, having faithful children not accused of riot or unruly.

verses.plain: For a bishop must be blameless, as the steward of God; not selfwilled, not soon angry, not given to wine, no striker, not given to filthy lucre;

tokens.t: For a bishop must be blameless, as the steward of God; not selfwilled, not soon angry, not given to wine, no striker, not given to filthy lucre;

verses.plain: But a lover of hospitality, a lover of good men, sober, just, holy, temperate;

tokens.t: But a lover of hospitality, a lover of good men, sober, just, holy, temperate;

verses.plain: Holding fast the faithful word as he hath been taught, that he may be able by sound doctrine both to exhort and to convince the gainsayers.

tokens.t: Holding fast the faithful word as he hath been taught, that he may be able by sound doctrine both to exhort and to convince the gainsayers.

verses.plain: For there are many unruly and vain talkers and deceivers, specially they of the circumcision:

tokens.t: For there are many unruly and vain talkers and deceivers, specially they of the circumcision:

verses.plain: Whose mouths must be stopped, who subvert whole houses, teaching things which they ought not, for filthy lucre’s sake.

tokens.t: Whose mouths must be stopped, who subvert whole houses, teaching things which they ought not, for filthy lucre’s sake.

verses.plain: One of themselves, even a prophet of their own, said, The Cretians are alway liars, evil beasts, slow bellies.

tokens.t: One of themselves,
a prophet of their own, said, The Cretians
alway liars, evil beasts, slow bellies.

verses.plain: This witness is true. Wherefore rebuke them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith;

tokens.t: This witness is true. Wherefore rebuke them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith;

verses.plain: Not giving heed to Jewish fables, and commandments of men, that turn from the truth.

tokens.t: Not giving heed to Jewish fables, and commandments of men, that turn from the truth.

verses.plain: Unto the pure all things are pure: but unto them that are defiled and unbelieving is nothing pure; but even their mind and conscience is defiled.

tokens.t: Unto the pure all things
pure: but unto them that are defiled and unbelieving
nothing pure; but even their mind and conscience is defiled.

verses.plain: They profess that they know God; but in works they deny him, being abominable, and disobedient, and unto every good work reprobate.

tokens.t: They profess that they know God; but in works they deny
, being abominable, and disobedient, and unto every good work reprobate.
